title: Liebman, Nakatani, Rudolph - The Unknowable (2018)
description: Dave Liebman, Tatsuya Nakatani, Adam Rudolph The Unknowable 2018 - RareNoise Records: RNR089 / RNR089LP https://www.rarenoiserecords.com/liebman-rudolph-nakatani * Dave Liebman : tenor saxophone, soprano saxophone, C flute, native american flute, recorder, piri, electric piano Fender Rhodes (10) * Tatsuya Nakatani: drum kit, gongs, metal percussion, percussion * Adam Rudolph : kongos, djembe, tarija, zabumba, thumb piano, sintir, mbuti harp, slit drum, percussion, overtone flutes, electric piano Fender Rhodes (11), live electronic processing http://www.davidliebman.com/ http://www.tatsuyanakatani.com/ http://www.metarecords.com/adam.html Recorded by James Dellatacoma at Orange Music Sound Studio, New Jersey, USA, on July 2016. Reviews ~~~~~~~ By George W. Harris https://www.jazzweekly.com/2018/05/dave-liebman-tatsuya-nakatani-adam-rudolph-the-unknowable/ David Liebman goes his most esoteric to date on this trio album with Tatsuya Nakatani/dr-perc and Adam Rudolph, who plays things like slit drum, thumb piano, sinti, mbuti harp and “live electronic processing.” Liebman, along with the usual tenor and soprano sax, brings in the C flute, native American flute, recorder, and even the fender Rhodes for a Baker’s Dozen improvisations. Liebman’s soprano is chirpy on the title track, while free and puffy with hand percussion on “The Simple Truth” and crying through the electronica of “The Turning.” His tenor bops on “Present Time” and is brooding during “Premonition.” Electronics and metallic percussion create edgy moods with a spacy flute on” Cosmogram” and finger percussion adds mystery to “Distant Twilight.” More mood and mystery than music. -- By Glenn Astarita https://www.allaboutjazz.com/the-unknowable-dave-liebman-rarenoiserecords-review-by-glenn-astarita.php By John Garratt https://www.popmatters.com/free-jazz-without-the-jazz-2549871060.html Tor Hammerø (no) http://torhammero.blogg.no/1528830340_noe_helt_for_seg_sjl.html Von iachelini (de) https://www.betreutesproggen.de/2018/09/dave-liebman-tatuya-nakatani-adam-rudolph-the-unknowable/ Da Michele Saran (it) http://www.ondarock.it/recensioni/2018-liebmannakatanirudolph-theunknowable.htm Par Xavier Prévost (fr)
